description:
Metschnikowia bicuspidata var. bicuspidata NRRL YB-4993 is a yeast strain that belongs to the species Metschnikowia bicuspidata. This variety, bicuspidata, is a sub-group within the species that exhibits distinct morphological and genetic characteristics.

Metschnikowia bicuspidata is a haplontic, ascosporogenous yeast that can be found in various ecological niches, such as the phylloplane, floral nectar, and the digestive tracts of insects. The strain NRRL YB-4993 was likely isolated from a specific environmental source and deposited in the NRRL (National Center for Agricultural Utilization Research) culture collection.

The key features of this yeast strain include its ability to form two-spored asci, which is a distinguishing characteristic of the variety bicuspidata. The cells typically exhibit an ellipsoidal or ovoid shape and can reproduce through budding. Additionally, this strain may possess unique physiological or metabolic properties that differentiate it from other members of the Metschnikowia bicuspidata species.

Further research on the genetics, physiology, and potential applications of this particular yeast strain could provide valuable insights into the diversity and ecological roles of the Metschnikowia genus.
